flawed_nl_solution:
The quilt is made of 16 squares on one side and 16 on the other so 16+16 = <<16+16=28>>28 squares total
She has already sewn 25% of the quilt so she has sown together 0.25*28 = <<25*0.01*28=7>>7 squares
Betsy still has 28-7 = <<28-7=21>>21 more squares to sew together
#### 21

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 32, not 28. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
